cell.seg: Bibliographic relationship values based on MODS version 3.4.

cell.eg: <content autoPrefix="true"> <valList type="closed" rend="add"> <valItem ident="preceding" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Temporal predecessor of the resource.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="succeeding" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Temporal successor to the resource.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="original" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Original form of the resource.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="host" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Parent containing the resource.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="constituent" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Intellectual or physical component of the resource.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="otherVersion" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Version of the resource’s intellectual content not changed enough to be a different work.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="otherFormat" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Version of the resource in a different physical format.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="isReferencedBy" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Published bibliographic description, review, abstract, or index of the resource's content.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="references" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Cited or referred to in the resource.</desc> </valItem> </valList> </content>

cell.seg: "Convenience" datatype that permits combining enumerated values with a user-supplied name.
For musical material designated to appear on an adjacent layer or staff, the location of the layer relative to the current one; i.e., the layer above or the layer below.

cell.eg: <content autoPrefix="true"> <valList type="closed" rend="add"> <valItem ident="above" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">The layer immediately above.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="below" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">The layer immediately below.</desc> </valItem> </valList> </content>

cell.seg: "Convenience" datatype that permits combining enumerated values with user-supplied values.

cell.eg: <content autoPrefix="true"> <valList type="closed" rend="add"> <valItem ident="botmar" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">At the foot of the page.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="topmar" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">At the top of the page.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="leftmar" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">At the left of the page.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="rightmar" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">At the right of the page.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="facing" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">On the opposite, <abbr>i.e.</abbr>, facing, page.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="overleaf" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">On the other side of the leaf.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="end" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">At the end of this division; <abbr>e.g.</abbr>, chapter, volume, etc.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="inter" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Within a line text; <abbr>i.e.</abbr>, an insertion.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="intra" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Between the lines of text, less exact than "sub" or "super".</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="super" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Above a line of text, more exact than "intra(linear)". Do not confuse with superscript rendition.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="sub" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Below a line of text, more exact than "intra(linear)". Do not confuse with subscript rendition.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="inspace" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">In a predefined space; <abbr>i.e.</abbr>, that left by an earlier scribe.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="superimposed" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Obscures original text; <abbr>e.g.</abbr>, via overstrike, addition of new writing surface material, etc.</desc> </valItem> </valList> </content>

<content autoPrefix="true"> <valList type="closed" rend="add"> <valItem ident="cmn" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Common Music Notation.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="mensural" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Mensural notation.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="mensural.black" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Black mensural notation.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="mensural.white" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">White mensural notation.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="neume" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Neumatic notation.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="tab" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Tablature notation.</desc> </valItem> </valList> </content>

cell.seg: Captures any notehead "modifiers"; that is, symbols added to the notehead, such as slashes, lines, text, and enclosures, etc.

cell.eg: <content autoPrefix="true"> <valList type="closed" rend="add"> <valItem ident="slash" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Slash (upper right to lower left).</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="backslash" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Backslash (upper left to lower right).</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="vline" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Vertical line.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="hline" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Horizontal line.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="centerdot" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Center dot.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="paren" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Enclosing parentheses.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="brack" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Enclosing square brackets.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="box" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Enclosing box.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="circle" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Enclosing circle.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="dblwhole" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Enclosing "fences".</desc> </valItem> </valList> </content>

cell.seg: Captures text rendered in the center of the notehead.
Oct attribute values. The default values conform to Acoustical Society of America representation. Read, p. 44.
The amount of octave displacement; that is, '8' (as in '8va' for 1 octave), '15' (for 2 octaves), or rarely '22' (for 3 octaves).
Rotation or reflection of base symbol values.

CMN ornam attribute values: A = appogiatura (upper neighbor); a = acciaccatura (lower neighbor); b = bebung; I = ascending slide; i = descending slide; k = delayed turn; K = 5-note turn; m = mordent (alternation with lower neighbor); M = inverted mordent (alternation with upper neighbor); N = Nachschlag (upper neighbor); n = Nachschlag (lower neighbor); S = turn; s = inverted turn; t = trill commencing on auxiliary note; T = trill commencing on principal note; O = generic / unspecified ornament.
The number of panels per page.

cell.eg: <content autoPrefix="true"> <valList type="closed" rend="add"> <valItem ident="line" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Continuous line with start and end positions rendered by vertical bars and bounces shown by upward-pointing "blips".</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="pedline" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Pedal down and half pedal rendered with "Ped." followed by a line with end position rendered by vertical bars and bounces shown by upward-pointing "blips".</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="pedstar" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Pedal down and half pedal rendered with "Ped.", pedal up rendered by "*", pedal "bounce" rendered with "* Ped.".</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="altpedstar" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Pedal up and down indications same as with "pedstar", but bounce is rendered with "Ped." only.</desc> </valItem> </valList> </content>

cell.seg: Positive decimal number between 0 and 100, followed by a percent sign "%".
Positive decimal number between -100 and 100, followed by a percent sign "%".
Page scale factor; a percentage of the values in page.height and page.width.
The pitch names (gamut) used within a single octave. The default values conform to Acoustical Society of America representation.
Gestural pitch names need an additional value for when the notated pitch is not to be sounded.
Pnum (pitch number, e.g., MIDI) attribute values.

div.head: data.PLACEMENT
div.table:
data.PLACEMENT Location information.
ModuleMEI
Used by
Element:
add/@place
Declaration data.PLACEMENT = data.STAFFREL | data.NONSTAFFPLACE | data.NMTOKEN
Other values not permitted when 'above', 'below', 'between' or 'within' is present.

cell.eg: <content autoPrefix="true"> <valList type="closed" rend="add"> <valItem ident="none" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">No rotation.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="down" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Rotated 180 degrees.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="left" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Rotated 270 degrees clockwise.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="ne" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Rotated 45 degrees clockwise.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="nw" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Rotated 315 degrees clockwise.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="se" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Rotated 135 degrees clockwise.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="sw" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Rotated 225 degrees clockwise.</desc> </valItem> </valList> </content>

cell.seg: The number of slashes to be rendered for tremolandi.
i=initial, m=medial, t=terminal. Number is used to match endpoints of the slur when slurs are nested or overlap.
Items that may be printed above, below, or between staves.
Items in all repertoires that may be printed near a staff.

cell.eg: <content autoPrefix="true"> <valList type="closed" rend="add"> <valItem ident="accid" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Accidentals.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="annot" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Annotations.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="artic" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Articulations.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="dir" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Directives.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="dynam" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Dynamics.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="harm" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Harmony indications.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="ornam" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Ornaments.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="sp" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Spoken text.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="stageDir" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Stage directions.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="tempo" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Tempo markings.</desc> </valItem> </valList> </content>

cell.seg: Items in the CMN repertoire that may be printed near a staff.

cell.eg: <content autoPrefix="true"> <valList type="closed" rend="add"> <valItem ident="beam" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Beams.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="bend" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Bend indications.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="bracketSpan" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Brackets, <abbr>e.g.</abbr>, for transcribed ligatures.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="breath" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Breath marks.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="cpMark" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Copy marks.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="fermata" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Fermatas.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="fing" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Fingerings.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="hairpin" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Hairpin dynamics.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="harpPedal" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Harp pedals.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="lv" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Laissez vibrer indications, sometimes called "open ties".</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="mordent" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Mordents.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="octave" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Octaviation marks.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="pedal" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Piano pedal marks.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="reh" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Rehearsal marks.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="tie" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Ties.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="trill" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Trills.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="tuplet" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Tuplets.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="turn" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Turns.</desc> </valItem> </valList> </content>

cell.seg: Staff location. The value '0' indicates the bottom line of the current staff; positive values are used for positions above the bottom line and negative values for the positions below. For example, in treble clef, 1 = F4, 2 = G4, 3 = A4, etc. and -1 = D4, -2 = C4, and so on.

div.head: data.STAFFREL
div.table:
data.STAFFREL Location of musical material relative to a staff.
ModuleMEI
Used by
data.PLACEMENT
Declaration data.STAFFREL = data.STAFFREL.basic | data.STAFFREL.extended
The @staff attribute must contain 2 numerically-adjacent integer values.
Staves and are not adjacent.

cell.seg: Location of symbol relative to a staff.

cell.eg: <content autoPrefix="true"> <valList type="closed" rend="add"> <valItem ident="above" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Above the staff.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="below" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Below the staff.</desc> </valItem> </valList> </content>

cell.seg: Location of symbol relative to a staff.

cell.eg: <content autoPrefix="true"> <valList type="closed" rend="add"> <valItem ident="between" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Between staves.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="within" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Within/on the staff.</desc> </valItem> </valList> </content>

<content autoPrefix="true"> <valList type="closed" rend="add"> <valItem ident="up" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Stem points upwards.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="down" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Stem points downwards.</desc> </valItem> </valList> </content>

<content autoPrefix="true"> <valList type="closed" rend="add"> <valItem ident="left" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Stem points left.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="right" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Stem points right.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="ne" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Stem points up and right.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="se" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Stem points down and right.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="nw" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Stem points up and left.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="sw" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Stem points down and left.</desc> </valItem> </valList> </content>

<content autoPrefix="true"> <valList type="closed" rend="add"> <valItem ident="none" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">No modifications to stem.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="1slash" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">1 slash through stem.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="2slash" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">2 slashes through stem.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="3slash" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">3 slashes through stem.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="4slash" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">4 slashes through stem.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="5slash" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">5 slashes through stem.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="6slash" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">6 slashes through stem.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="sprech" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">X placed on stem.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="z" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Z placed on stem.</desc> </valItem> </valList> </content>

cell.seg: Position of a note’s stem relative to the head of the note.

cell.eg: <content autoPrefix="true"> <valList type="closed" rend="add"> <valItem ident="left" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Stem attached to left side of note head.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="right" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Stem attached to right side of note head.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="center" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Stem is originates from center of note head.</desc> </valItem> </valList> </content>

<content autoPrefix="true"> <valList type="closed" rend="add"> <valItem ident="equal" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Equal or 12-tone temperament.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="just" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Just intonation.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="mean" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Meantone intonation.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="pythagorean" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Pythagorean tuning.</desc> </valItem> </valList> </content>

cell.seg: Beats (meter signature denominator) per minute, e.g., 120.
Closed list of text rendition values.

cell.eg: <content autoPrefix="true"> <valList type="closed" rend="add"> <valItem ident="quote" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Surrounded by single quotes.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="quotedbl" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Surrounded by double quotes.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="italic" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Italicized (slanted to right).</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="oblique" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Oblique (slanted to left).</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="smcaps" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Small capitals.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="bold" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Relative font weight.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="bolder" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Relative font weight.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="lighter" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Relative font weight.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="box" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Enclosed in box.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="circle" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Enclosed in ellipse/circle.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="dbox" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Enclosed in diamond.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="tbox" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Enclosed in triangle.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="bslash" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Struck through by '\' (back slash).</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="fslash" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Struck through by '/' (forward slash).</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="line-through" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Struck through by '-'; may be qualified to indicate multiple parallel lines, <abbr>e.g.</abbr>, line-through(2).</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="none" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Not rendered, invisible.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="overline" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Line above the text; may be qualified to indicate multiple parallel lines, <abbr>e.g.</abbr>, overline(3).</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="overstrike" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Use for deleted text fully or partially obscured by other text (such as 'XXXXX') or musical symbols (such as notes, rests, etc.).</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="strike" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Struck through by '-'; equivalent to line-through; may be qualified to indicate multiple parallel lines, <abbr>e.g.</abbr>, strike(3).</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="sub" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Subscript.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="sup" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Superscript.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="superimpose" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Use for added text or musical symbols that fully or partially obscure text from an earlier writing stage.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="underline" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Underlined; may be qualified to indicate multiple parallel lines, <abbr>e.g.</abbr>, underline(2).</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="x-through" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Crossed-out; equivalent to 'bslash' (\) plus 'fslash' (/); that is, a hand-written 'X'; may be qualified to indicate multiple parallel lines, <abbr>e.g.</abbr>, x-through(2).</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="ltr" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Left-to-right (BIDI embed).</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="rtl" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Right-to-left (BIDI embed).</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="lro" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Left-to-right (BIDI override).</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="rlo" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Right-to-left (BIDI override).</desc> </valItem> </valList> </content>

cell.seg: Tie attribute values: initial, medial, terminal.
A positive or negative offset from the value given in the tstamp attribute in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part].
Tuplet attribute values: initial, medial, terminal.

list.item: handShift/@new
handShift/@old

cell.seg: Data values for attributes that capture vertical alignment.

cell.eg: <content autoPrefix="true"> <valList type="closed" rend="add"> <valItem ident="top" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Top aligned.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="middle" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Middle aligned.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="bottom" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Bottom aligned.</desc> </valItem> <valItem ident="baseline" rend="add"> <desc xml:lang="en">Baseline aligned.</desc> </valItem> </valList> </content>

cell.seg: A single "word" that contains only letters, digits, punctuation characters, or symbols. It cannot contain whitespace.

row.cell: macro.annot.content (Supported MEI elements) Supported MEI elements as content of annotations.

<elementRef key="anchoredText" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="app" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="artic" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="barLine" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="beam" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="bTrem" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="caesura" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="chord" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="clef" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="corr" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="del" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="dir" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="dot" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="dynam" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="ending" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="fermata" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="fTrem" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="hairpin" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="key" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="keyAccid" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="keySig" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="lb" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="meterSig" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="mRpt" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="mRest" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="mSpace" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="name" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="note" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="num" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="octave" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="ornam" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="pb" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="ptr" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="q" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="quote" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="rest" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="sb" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="section" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="seg" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="slur" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="space" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="subst" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="syl" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="tempo" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="tie" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="trill" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <elementRef key="tuplet" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </sequence> </content>

macro.annot.content = ( text, accid*, add*, anchoredText*, app*, artic*, barLine*, beam*, bTrem*, caesura*, chord*, clef*, corr*, del*, dir*, dot*, dynam*, ending*, fermata*, fTrem*, hairpin*, key*, keyAccid*, keySig*, lb*, meterSig*, mRpt*, mRest*, mSpace*, name*, note*, num*, octave*, ornam*, pb*, ptr*, q*, quote*, rest*, sb*, section*, seg*, slur*, space*, subst*, syl*, tempo*, tie*, trill*, tuplet* )+

cell.seg: Groups manifestation- and item-specific elements that may appear as part of a bibliographic description.

cell.eg: macro.bibldescPart = editionStmt?, pubStmt?, availability?, physDesc*, physLoc*, seriesStmt*

row.cell: macro.list.lang (Supported languages) Supported languages at crApp-WebApp.

list.item: language/@codedval

cell.eg: <content> <valList rend="add" type="closed"> <valItem ident="de"> <gloss xml:lang="de" versionDate="2023-01-02">deutsch</gloss> <gloss xml:lang="en" versionDate="2023-01-02">german</gloss> </valItem> <valItem ident="en"> <gloss xml:lang="de" versionDate="2023-01-02">englisch</gloss> <gloss xml:lang="en" versionDate="2023-01-02">english</gloss> </valItem> </valList> </content>

cell.seg: Groups elements that contain meta-data about a single page.

row.cell:
(value check for measure count) Checks if the given count exists in the meter.
<sch:rule context="crapp:measure[@count]|crapp:range[@count]"> <sch:let name="meterCount" value="./ancestor::crapp:crApp/crapp:setting//crapp:meter/@count"/> <sch:let name="meterUnit" value="./ancestor::crapp:crApp/crapp:setting//crapp:meter/@unit"/> <sch:report role="fatal" test="./@count/number() gt $meterCount/number()">Unavailable count! The meter is <sch:value-of select="$meterCount"/>/<sch:value-of select="$meterUnit"/>.</sch:report> </sch:rule>

(value check for part combination) Checks if the named parts at a remark are redundant, e.g., if the part groupis called also.
<sch:rule context="crapp:remark//crapp:part"> <sch:let name="partVal" value="./text()"/> <sch:let name="partGrpVals" value="ancestor::crapp:remark//crapp:partGrp/text()"/> <sch:report test=".[ancestor::crapp:crApp/crapp:setting//crapp:part[@xml:id = $partVal]/ancestor::crapp:partGrp[@xml:id][@xml:id = ($partGrpVals)]]" role="warning"> <sch:value-of select="$partVal"/> is part of <sch:value-of select="($partGrpVals)[last()]"/>. A second call might be redundant.</sch:report> </sch:rule>

(value check for part group combination) Checks if the named part groups at a remark are redundant, e.g., if the parent or ancestor group is called also.
<sch:rule context="crapp:remark//crapp:partGrp"> <sch:let name="partGrpVal" value="./text()"/> <sch:let name="partGrpVals" value="ancestor::crapp:remark//crapp:partGrp[not(text() = $partGrpVal)]/text()"/> <sch:report test="ancestor::crapp:crApp/crapp:setting//crapp:partGrp[@xml:id = $partGrpVal]/ancestor::crapp:partGrp[@xml:id][@xml:id = ($partGrpVals)]" role="warning"> <sch:value-of select="$partGrpVal"/> is part of <sch:value-of select="($partGrpVals)[last()]"/>. A second call might be redundant.</sch:report> </sch:rule>

(set namespace) Declaration of namespaces for schematron.
<sch:ns uri="http://baumann-digital.de/ns/crApp"/> <sch:ns prefix="crapp" uri="http://baumann-digital.de/ns/crApp"/> <sch:ns prefix="mei" uri="http://www.music-encoding.org/ns/mei"/> <sch:ns prefix="tei" uri="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"/>

(value check for setting) Checks if the used values are defined somwhere in the <setting> element.
<sch:schema queryBinding="xslt2"> <sch:ns uri="http://baumann-digital.de/ns/crApp" prefix="crapp"/> <xsl:function name="functx:is-value-in-sequence" as="xs:boolean"> <xsl:param name="value" as="xs:anyAtomicType?"/> <xsl:param name="seq" as="xs:anyAtomicType*"/> <xsl:sequence select="$value = $seq"/> </xsl:function> <xsl:function name="crapp:checkValues"> <xsl:param name="elem" as="node()"/> <xsl:param name="attName" as="xs:string"/> <xsl:variable name="lang" select="$elem/ancestor::crapp:setting/crapp:language/@codedval"/> <xsl:variable name="elemName" select="local-name($elem)"/> <xsl:variable name="elemText" select="$elem/text()"/> <xsl:variable name="setVals" select="$elem/ancestor::crapp:crApp//crapp:setting//node()[local-name()=$elemName]"/> <xsl:value-of select="functx:is-value-in-sequence($elemText, if($setVals/attribute::node()[local-name()=$attName])then($setVals/attribute::node()[local-name()=$attName]) else($setVals/crapp:label[@xml:lang=$lang]/text()))"/> </xsl:function> <xsl:function name="crapp:valuesAllowed"> <xsl:param name="elem" as="node()"/> <xsl:param name="attName" as="xs:string"/> <xsl:variable name="lang" select="$elem/ancestor::crapp:setting/crapp:language/@codedval"/> <xsl:variable name="elemName" select="local-name($elem)"/> <xsl:variable name="elemText" select="$elem/text()"/> <xsl:variable name="setVals" select="$elem/ancestor::crapp:crApp//crapp:setting//node()[local-name()=$elemName]"/> <xsl:for-each select="$setVals"> <xsl:value-of select="if(attribute::node()[local-name()=$attName]) then(attribute::node()[local-name()=$attName]/string()) else(text())"/> </xsl:for-each> </xsl:function> <xsl:function name="crapp:valuesAllowedJoined"> <xsl:param name="elem" as="node()"/> <xsl:param name="attName" as="xs:string"/> <xsl:value-of select="string-join(crapp:valuesAllowed($elem, $attName), ', ')"/> </xsl:function> <sch:pattern abstract="true" id="checkValues"> <sch:rule context="crapp:remark//node()[local-name()='$elementName']"> <sch:assert test="exists(ancestor::crapp:crApp/crapp:setting//node()[local-name()='$elementName'])" role="fatal">No setting for <sch:value-of select="local-name(.)"/> defined. Please define the setting before use.</sch:assert> <sch:report test="exists(ancestor::crapp:crApp/crapp:setting//node()[local-name()='$elementName']) and crapp:checkValues(., '$attrStr') = false()" role="error">The value <sch:value-of select="."/> is not allowed here. Please use one of these: <sch:value-of select="crapp:valuesAllowedJoined(., '$attrStr')"/>.</sch:report> </sch:rule> </sch:pattern> </sch:schema>
